SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

xxl.applications.pipes
Class ExampleQueries

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.pipes.ExampleQueries

public class ExampleQueries
extends Object

Provides numberous examples to demonstrate the usage of pipes for stream processing.
Content
1) Different types of data sources and sinks.
1.1) Simple synthetic sources
1.2) NexMark generator
1.2) Real data set from Free Service Patrol
2) Queries with focus on a single operator
2.1) Selections
2.2) Maps (projection, temporal window, timegranularity)
2.3) Unions
2.4) Joins
2.5) Aggregates
2.6) Distinct.
2.7) Difference.
3) Complex queries
3.1) Queries using real data sets from Free Service Patrol
3.1.1) Merge some streams via TemporalUnion and remove noise with Filter.
3.1.2) Merge streams with TemporalUnion and compute the average speed.
3.1.3) Jam detection involves Mapper, Temporalwindow, TemporalAggregate, and Filter.
3.2) Queries using NexMark
3.2.1) Monitor the average closing price across items in each category over the last hour.
3.2.2) Report all auctions that closed within 5 hours of their opening.
3.2.3) Merge stream and relation: For each closed auction report all available information on the buyer.
3.2.4) Get hot items: Select the items with the most bids in the past 10 minutes.
4) Metadata examples

insertGUIBeforeAndAfter

public static <I,O> void insertGUIBeforeAndAfter(QueryExecutor exe,
                                                 Pipe<I,O> pipe,
                                                 Function<I,?> inputMap,
                                                 Function<O,?> outputMap)
A helper method to demonstrate the effect of operators. It registers VisualSink that display the elements of all inputs and the output of the given operator.

sourceRandomIntegers

public static void sourceRandomIntegers()
Create a new source producing 200 discrete random integer with a constant output rate of 5 millis and writes its elements to System.out

sourceEnumerator

public static void sourceEnumerator()
Create a stream consisting of integer from 1000 to 12000 with a constant output rate of 5 millis. Write every 50 millis how many elements have been seen so far to System.out.

sourceCursorSource

public static void sourceCursorSource()
Create a source that uses an Iterator and the class CursorSource to produce elements and write its elements to VisualSink.

sourceNEXMark

public static void sourceNEXMark()
Create a source that creates a open auction stream using NEXMark. CQL SELECT * FROM OpenAution;

sourceHighway

public static void sourceHighway()
Create a source that emits data collected from the FSP. CQL SELECT * FROM Sensor1, ..., Sensor5"

selectionSimple

public static void selectionSimple()
Generates a synthetic stream and drops every second element.

selectionWatchAuction

public static void selectionWatchAuction()
Report every Bid for a selected auction.

selectionLoadShedding

public static void selectionLoadShedding()
Example for load shedding in the highway szenario. This query could be part of a query, which detects taffic jams. If the system load is high, the system may decide to drop some elements.

mapSimpleMapper

public static void mapSimpleMapper()
Apply projection to stream in highway Szenario using the class Mapper. An element (timestamp,id, lane, length, speed) is mapped to (id, lane, speed). CQL SELECT id, lane, speed FROM Sensor1;

mapToTempObj

public static void mapToTempObj()
Map an Object to TemporalObject. This is important for stateful temporal operators, because it determines expiration. In the example, an Integer is mapped to an instance of Temporalobject. Afterwards the lifespan is set to 1000 via TemporalWindow.

mapSetGranularity

public static void mapSetGranularity()
Set timegranularity for TemporalObject.

unionMerge

public static void unionMerge()
Use Union to merge streams.

unionTemporal

public static void unionTemporal()
Use TemporalUnion to merge streams and ensure timestamp order in output stream.

joinSimpleNonTemporalHashJoin

public static void joinSimpleNonTemporalHashJoin()
A join without temporal semantic.

joinTemporalCartesianProduct

public static void joinTemporalCartesianProduct()
Computes a temporal Cartesian Product.

joinTemporalNestedLoopsJoin

public static void joinTemporalNestedLoopsJoin()
A temporal nested loops join example that uses an asymmetric join predicate.

joinTemporalHashJoin

public static void joinTemporalHashJoin()

public static void aggregatorExample()
Example for the Aggregator

aggregatorTemporalExample

public static void aggregatorTemporalExample()

distinctTemporalExample

public static void distinctTemporalExample()
Example for the TemporalDistinct.

differenceTemporalExample

public static void differenceTemporalExample()
Example for the TemporalDifference.

queryHighwayRemoveNoise

public static void queryHighwayRemoveNoise()
3.1.1) Merge some streams via TemporalUnion and remove noise with Filter. CQL SELECT timestamp, distance, lane, speed, length, direction FROM Sensor1, ..., Sensor5 WHERE length >= '1' AND length <= '50' AND speed >= '0' AND speed <= '100';

queryHighwayMergeAndAggregate

public static void queryHighwayMergeAndAggregate()
3.1.2) Merge some streams via TemporalUnion and compute the average speed. CQL SELECT AVG(length) FROM (SELECT length FROM Sensor1 [Range 15 minutes] WHERE lane = '1'; UNION ALL ... UNION ALL SELECT length FROM Sensor18 [Range 15 minutes] WHERE lane = '1';);

queryHighwayJamDetection

public static void queryHighwayJamDetection()
3.1.2) Jam detection involves Mapper, Temporalwindow, Temporalaggregate, Filter CQL SELECT AVG(speed) AS avgSpeed, distance FROM ( SELECT speed, distance FROM SensorRow1 [Range 15 minutes] UNION ALL ... UNION ALL SELECT speed, distance FROM SensorRow17 [Range 15 minutes] ); WHERE avgSpeed < 15;

queryNEXMarkAVGClosingPrice

public static void queryNEXMarkAVGClosingPrice()
3.2.1) Monitor the average closing price across items in each category over the last hour. CQL SELECT categoryID, AVG(price) FROM ClosedAuctions [RANGE 1 hour] GROUP BY categoryID;

queryNEXMarkJoinCloseOpenAuction

public static void queryNEXMarkJoinCloseOpenAuction()
3.2.2) Report all auctions that closed within 5 hours of their opening. CQL SELECT OpenAuction.* FROM OpenAuction [Range 5 hours] O, ClosedAuction [NOW] C WHERE O.auctionID = C.auctionID;

queryNEXMarkStreamAndRelation

public static void queryNEXMarkStreamAndRelation()
3.2.3) Merge stream and relation: For each closed auction report all available information on the buyer. CQL SELECT Person.* FROM ClosedAuction C, Person P WHERE C.buyerID = P.ID;

queryNEXMarkHotItems

public static void queryNEXMarkHotItems()
3.2.3) Get hot items: Select the items with the most bids in the past 10 minutes. SELECT itemID, num FROM (SELECT B1.itemID AS itemID, COUNT(*) AS num FROM Bid [RANGE 10 minutes] B1 GROUP BY B1.itemID) WHERE num >= ALL (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Bid [RANGE 10 minutes] B2 GROUP BY B2.itemID);

metaDataSelection

public static void metaDataSelection()

metaDataJoin

public static void metaDataJoin()

metaDataAggregator

public static void metaDataAggregator()

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Provides numberous examples to demonstrate the usage of pipes for stream processing.
